recommendations.title: Remove or Protect Direct Identifiers
recommendations.description: Direct identifiers (Full Name, Email, SSN, Phone Number, Street Address) can directly identify individuals and should be removed, hashed, or pseudonymized.
recommendations.action: Apply pseudonymization or cryptographic hashing to these attributes.

recommendations.title: Improve K-Anonymity
recommendations.description: Dataset achieves k=1 but requires k=5. 35 records are in violating equivalence classes.
recommendations.action: Generalize quasi-identifier values or suppress outlier records.

recommendations.title: Improve L-Diversity
recommendations.description: Dataset achieves l=1 diversity but requires l=2. Some equivalence classes have only one unique sensitive value, enabling attribute disclosure.
recommendations.action: Apply anatomy or bucketization to sensitive attributes.

recommendations.title: Apply Pseudonymization
recommendations.description: Direct identifiers should be pseudonymized or removed.
recommendations.action: Apply Pseudonymization to: Full Name, Email, SSN, Phone Number, Street Address

recommendations.title: Apply Hashing
recommendations.description: Consider hashing direct identifiers if linkage is needed.
recommendations.action: Apply Hashing to: Full Name, Email, SSN, Phone Number, Street Address

recommendations.title: Apply Generalization
recommendations.description: Quasi-identifiers should be generalized to achieve k-anonymity.
recommendations.action: Apply Generalization to: Date of Birth, Zip Code, City, Country, Occupation

recommendations.title: Address Distributional Skew
recommendations.description: Maximum distributional distance (0.498) exceeds threshold (0.15). This could enable inference attacks.
recommendations.action: Apply data swapping or noise addition to reduce skew in equivalence classes.

recommendations.title: Apply Bucketing
recommendations.description: Sensitive attributes could benefit from bucketing.
recommendations.action: Apply Bucketing to: Annual Salary, Medical Condition, Credit Score
